intro: Osteomeles gayana, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red, with a prominent yellow stamen. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth texture, often covered in a fine white wax. Osteomeles gayana thrives in coastal and lowland habitats, and it plays an important role in the local ecosystem.
